sections.heading: The Three Verb Groups
sections.content:
All Japanese verbs belong to one of three groups:

Godan verbs (五段動詞) - Group 1 / u-verbs Ichidan verbs (一段動詞) - Group 2 / ru-verbs Irregular verbs (不規則動詞) - Only 2 verbs!

Understanding which group a verb belongs to is essential for conjugation.

sections.heading: Why Groups Matter
sections.content:
Each group conjugates differently:

食べる (eat) - Ichidan 食べます → 食べて → 食べない 書く (write) - Godan 書きます → 書いて → 書かない

Different patterns, same conjugation type.

children.heading: Identification
children.content:
Godan verbs end in -u sounds in dictionary form:

-u: 買う (kau) -ku: 書く (kaku) -gu: 泳ぐ (oyogu) -su: 話す (hanasu) -tsu: 待つ (matsu) -nu: 死ぬ (shinu) -bu: 遊ぶ (asobu) -mu: 読む (yomu) -ru: 帰る (kaeru)

children.heading: The "Five Steps" (Godan)
children.content:
Name comes from using five different vowel sounds when conjugating:

書く (kaku) - write kak-a-nai (a row - negative) kak-i-masu (i row - polite) kak-u (u row - dictionary) kak-e-ba (e row - conditional) kak-o-u (o row - volitional)

children.heading: Common Godan Verbs
children.content: 行く (iku) - go 飲む (nomu) - drink 読む (yomu) - read 書く (kaku) - write 話す (hanasu) - speak 待つ (matsu) - wait 買う (kau) - buy 帰る (kaeru) - return 分かる (wakaru) - understand 作る (tsukuru) - make

children.heading: Identification
children.content:
Ichidan verbs end in -eru or -iru :

-eru verbs: 食べる (taberu) - eat 教える (oshieru) - teach 見せる (miseru) - show -iru verbs: 見る (miru) - see 起きる (okiru) - wake up 着る (kiru) - wear

children.heading: The "One Step" (Ichidan)
children.content:
Name comes from using one vowel stem (e or i):

食べる (taberu) - eat tabe-nai (remove る, add nai) tabe-masu (remove る, add masu) tabe-te (remove る, add te)

Stem never changes, just add endings!

children.heading: Common Ichidan Verbs
children.content: 食べる (taberu) - eat 見る (miru) - see/watch 寝る (neru) - sleep 起きる (okiru) - wake up 教える (oshieru) - teach 着る (kiru) - wear 開ける (akeru) - open 閉める (shimeru) - close 出る (deru) - go out いる (iru) - exist (animate)

sections.heading: Group 3: Irregular Verbs (不規則動詞)
sections.content: Only two verbs are truly irregular:

children.heading: する (suru) - to do
children.content: します (shimasu) して (shite) しない (shinai)

children.heading: 来る (kuru) - to come
children.content: 来ます (kimasu) 来て (kite) 来ない (konai)

children.heading: Compound Verbs
children.content:
Many verbs use する:

勉強する (benkyou suru) - study 料理する (ryouri suru) - cook 電話する (denwa suru) - phone

These all conjugate like する.

sections.heading: The -ru Verb Trap
sections.content: Problem: Some Godan verbs look like Ichidan verbs!

children.heading: Godan verbs ending in -ru
children.content: 帰る (kaeru) - return [Godan] 走る (hashiru) - run [Godan] 知る (shiru) - know [Godan] 切る (kiru) - cut [Godan]

children.heading: How to Tell the Difference
children.content:
Check what comes before -ru:

Ichidan (-eru/-iru):

食べる (tab-eru) - vowel + eru ✓ 見る (m-iru) - consonant + iru ✓

Godan (other sounds + ru):

帰る (kae-ru) - ae + ru = Godan 走る (hashi-ru) - i + ru BUT: hashi = consonant ending 知る (shi-ru) - i + ru BUT: shi ends in consonant sound

Rule of thumb: If before る is:

a, o, u + ru → Always Godan i, e + ru → Could be either (check dictionary)

sections.heading: Identification Chart
sections.content: | Ending | Type | Examples | | -------------------------------------- | --------- | ---------------- | | -u, -ku, -gu, -su, -tsu, -bu, -mu, -nu | Godan | 買う、書く、泳ぐ | | -eru (most cases) | Ichidan | 食べる、教える | | -iru (most cases) | Ichidan | 見る、起きる | | -aru, -oru, -uru | Godan | 帰る、走る、知る | | する | Irregular | する、勉強する | | 来る | Irregular | 来る |

children.heading: Ichidan: Drop る, add masu
children.content: 食べる → 食べます ✓ 見る → 見ます ✓

children.heading: Godan: Change う sound to い, add masu
children.content:
書く → 書きます ✓ 飲む → 飲みます ✓ 帰る → 帰ります ✓ (NOT 帰えます)

If it becomes 帰ります, it's Godan!

children.heading: Mistake 1: Assuming All -ru Verbs are Ichidan
children.content: Wrong: 帰る → 帰ます ❌ Right: 帰る → 帰ります ✓ (Godan) Wrong: 知る → 知ます ❌ Right: 知る → 知ります ✓ (Godan)

children.heading: Mistake 2: Not Checking the Dictionary
children.content:
When in doubt, check . Dictionaries mark verb types:

五 or v5 = Godan 一 or v1 = Ichidan vs = する verb vk = 来る

children.heading: Mistake 3: Conjugating Ichidan as Godan
children.content: Wrong: 食べる → 食びます ❌ Right: 食べる → 食べます ✓ Wrong: 見る → 見ります ❌ Right: 見る → 見ます ✓

children.heading: Identify the group:
children.content: 1. 話す → Godan (-su ending) 2. 教える → Ichidan (-eru) 3. する → Irregular 4. 飲む → Godan (-mu ending) 5. 寝る → Ichidan (-eru) 6. 来る → Irregular 7. 帰る → Godan (-aru) 8. 見る → Ichidan (-iru) 9. 買う → Godan (-u ending) 10. 着る → Ichidan (-iru)

children.heading: Definitely Godan
children.content: -u, -ku, -gu, -su, -tsu, -bu, -mu, -nu endings

children.heading: Definitely Ichidan
children.content: -eru/-iru where e/i is preceded by a vowel sound 食べる (taberu), 起きる (okiru)

children.heading: Check Dictionary
children.content: -aru, -oru, -uru -iru/-eru after consonant sounds

children.heading: Irregular
children.content: する (suru) and 来る (kuru) only

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Three groups: Godan, Ichidan, Irregular ✓ Godan uses 5 vowel sounds when conjugating ✓ Ichidan uses 1 stem ✓ Only 2 irregular verbs: する and 来る ✓ Some -ru verbs are Godan (check dictionary) ✓ Group determines conjugation pattern

Master verb groups first - everything else becomes easier!

Next: Dictionary Form (Plain)

Related:

Masu Form (Polite Present) Te-form Conjugation Verb Basics

examples.sentence: Godan verbs (五段動詞) - Group 1 / u-verbs
Ichidan verbs (一段動詞) - Group 2 / ru-verbs
Irregular verbs (不規則動詞) - Only 2 verbs!
a, o, u + ru → Always Godan
i, e + ru → Could be either (check dictionary)
